text: p_initially_infected proportion initial infected. p_already_recovered proportion already recovered infection.

title: Initial conditions for SIR models — initial_conditions
Initial conditions for SIR models — initial_conditions
SIR epidemic model using 'deSolve' — sir_desolve
code: sir_desolve(   times = seq(0, 200, length.out = 2001),   init = initial_conditions(p_initially_infected = 0.01),   parms = c(beta = 0.1, gamma = 0.05) )

title: SIR epidemic model using 'deSolve' — sir_desolve
text: times sequence timepoints solve proportion population state (susceptible, infected, recovered). init initial conditions population: named vector proportions population state ("S": susceptible, "": infected, "R": recovered). Can easily constructed using helper function [initial_conditions()]. parms infection parameters form named vector element "beta" rate transmission \(\beta\), "gamma" rate recovery infected individuals \(\gamma\). Formally, \(beta\) \(gamma\) rate parameters separate exponential distributions.

title: SIR epidemic model using 'deSolve' — sir_desolve
text: data table proportion population susceptible, infected, recovered states time point times. data returned tidy format, \(3T\) rows, \(T\) number timepoints.
